conclusion: Use thermodynamics principles to analyze the p-V diagram.
State A: V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3, P_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa; State B: V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m^3, P_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa; State C: V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3, P_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Process A → B is isochoric; Process B → C is isobaric.
Temperature at state A is 27°C = 300 K.
Calculate T_B using isochoric process: T_B = 100 K.
Calculate T_C using isobaric process: T_C = 300 K.
Process A → B: No work done, ΔU_AB = -2nC_V, Q_AB = -2nC_V.
Process B → C: Work done W_BC = 200 J, ΔU_BC = 2nC_V, Q_BC = 2nC_V + 200 J.
